reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: FLC: Siloam Integrated Children Support Charity

description.narrative: Improve the condition to reduce the vulnerability of children and women/girls residing in Holeta town in Oromia Special Zone of Ethiopia. The project enables 500 children to go to school including the ongoing ones. The project targeted the children under risk of going to the street as most of them are orphans and live with extended families or people that knew their families. The risk associated to street children is related to increase in violence and threat to the safety and security of the community. In stead the project enhances the number of children that has access to education and eventually developing the human power of the country. Apart from children the project has embraced 75 women that are care givers of the children in an income generation sche me. The co-actors in the project are the woreda bureau of women children and youth affairs woreda bureau of education and the municipality of Holeta town.

tag.narrative: Improving democracy in societies is the main priority area in this activity
